p: In 1998, subgenogroup C4 emerged for the first time in the western Pacific region and caused severe epidemic beginning in China in 2008 [ 36, 110, 111]. C4 subsequently expanded to the rest of the region and caused major epidemics in several countries. Some of these outbreaks were associated with severe neurological complications and fatality cases, such as in Australia (2013) [ 41], Cambodia (2012) [ 44], Laos (2011) [ 119], Mongolia (2007, 2010) [ 120, 121], South Korea (2009–2012) [ 112], Vietnam (2011–2012 and 2018) (Table 1 and Fig. 3) [ 99, 101].
